sectionText: This newly designed section is offered to students in Biology, IB, MCB, and related life science majors who are interested in seeing mathematical ideas being directly applied to exciting biological problems. While the material consists of standard Math 220 topics, it will be taught with examples from the biological sciences using a special life sciences math textbook. It will include an introduction to R.  Placement in this course requires an adequate, recent score on the U of I ALEKS math placement exam, as described at  http://math.illinois.edu/ALEKS  Students planning to transfer to a life sciences major may e-mail mathadvising@illinois.edu with name, netid, UIN, current major, and "BioCalculus approval request" in order to request registration approval, space permitting.  Some approval requests will be held for consideration until November 18.
sectionNotes: Restricted to Food Science & Human Nutrition or Natural Resrcs & Environ Sci or Natural Res & Env Sciences or Biology or Kinesiology or Molecular and Cellular Biology or Integrative Biology major(s).
